definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]

sentences.english: What was it that made you zigzag all over Paris like a hunted deer?
sentences.chinese: 又是什么使你曲里拐弯各地巴黎像猎杀鹿？

sentences.english: All along a narrow way that marks a crooked line.
sentences.chinese: 沿着一条曲里拐弯的狭窄道路。

definition: meandering and circuitous (idiom); to go around in circles and never get anywhere
meandering and circuitous (idiom); complicated developments that never get anywhere/going around in circles
erhua variant of 拐彎|拐弯[guai3 wan1]
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
road as twisty as sheep's intestine (idiom); narrow and winding road/fig. complicated and tricky job
winding road (twisting and turning like a sheep's intestine)
